meanings.definition: An area of land surrounding a barn where animals are kept.
meanings.sent1: The barnyards were filled with cows and chickens.
meanings.sent2: The farmer fed the animals in the barnyards every morning.
meanings.sent3: The pig decided to throw a party in the barnyards.
meanings.sent4: The barnyards were a bustling community of furry and feathered friends.
meanings.sent5: The children loved playing hide-and-seek in the barnyards.

meanings.definition: The yard or area immediately surrounding a barn.
meanings.sent1: The barnyards were neat and well-maintained.
meanings.sent2: The farmer stored his tools in the barnyards.
meanings.sent3: The barnyards became a maze of hay bales after the storm.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast eerie shadows in the empty barnyards.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh hay filled the barnyards on a sunny day.
